main event: An unidentified round red object was sighted by a CAA operator near Klamath Falls and Medford, Oregon on February 26, 1953.
interesting points: The object remained completely stationary but faded and reappeared at intervals.
The observer estimated the object to be at an altitude of 5,700-6,000 feet and a distance of 10,000 feet.
The weather conditions were scattered clouds at 2,500 feet with 10 miles visibility.
Project Blue Book and its contract astronomer evaluated the report as being caused by the astronomical body Venus.
Similar reports have been received by CAA/ATIC-filtering personnel and often found to be caused by Venus, which can appear intermittent and change in color due to its low position on the horizon.
witnesses: CAA operator, unidentified observer in Medford
